title: 01 - Structure Mapping - Forex Trend Finding

market_structure.llm_summary: Market Structure is the systematic identification of trend direction through analysis of swing highs and swing lows. This is the foundation of ICT/SMC trading - 50% of forex success depends on valid structural mapping. Bullish trend creates Higher Highs (HH) and Higher Lows (HL). Bearish trend creates Lower Lows (LL) and Lower Highs (LH). Smart Money traders use different validation rules than retail traders.
key_rules: HH confirmed when market takes out inducement from previous swing
Candle body must close above previous high (not just wick)
If only wick breaks high, mark as liquidity sweep

higher_high.llm_summary: Higher High (HH) is a swing high that is higher than the previous swing high, confirming bullish trend continuation. In SMC, a valid HH requires the inducement to be taken out first and the candle body must close above the previous high. If only the wick trades above (body closes below), it's a liquidity sweep, not a valid HH.

higher_low.llm_summary: Higher Low (HL) is a swing low that is higher than the previous swing low, confirming bullish trend continuation. Forms the pullback point in an uptrend. HL is only valid when it follows a valid HH. This is the ideal entry zone for long positions in a confirmed bullish trend.

inducement.llm_summary: Inducement (also known as Smart Money Trap) is the first pullback (minor swing) on the left side of the current high. It represents a liquidity pool where retail traders place stop losses. Smart Money must take out this inducement before a valid structural move. Swings without inducement taken are NOT valid higher highs/lows. This is one of the two major driving forces of forex market.
key_rules: Located at first pullback on left side of recent high
Must be taken out (price must trade through it) for valid HH/HL
One of the two major driving forces of forex market

liquidity_sweep.llm_summary: Liquidity Sweep occurs when price wicks above a high but the candle body does NOT close above it. This indicates Smart Money is hunting stop losses (liquidity) rather than making a genuine breakout. Liquidity includes pending orders, stop losses, breakeven levels, highs and lows. Do NOT mark as Higher High if it's just a liquidity sweep.

swing_high.llm_summary: Swing High is a price peak used to map market structure. In SMC, not every peak qualifies as a valid swing high for trading purposes. A swing high must be validated using inducement and candle close rules before it can be used for structure mapping.

swing_low.llm_summary: Swing Low is a price trough used to map market structure. In SMC, valid swing lows form after valid swing highs and represent potential entry zones in uptrends or confirmation points in downtrends.

key_insights: 50% of forex success depends on valid structural mapping
Trend is your friend - once you understand trend mapping, you can find high probability entries
Always look for inducement and candle closing to map real and accurate structure
This will help filter fake and invalid setups, significantly increasing winning ratio
Liquidity and inducement are the two major driving forces of the forex market
